attributes.action: Ensure HIV treatment and support services receive the funding they need
attributes.background: HIV treatment and support services are vital for those who rely on them and for the wider public health of society. In the context of cuts to public health budgets, the Government must make provision to ensure that the integral role HIV services play is protected.

attributes.action: Give More benefits and income allowance for single parents In higher education
attributes.background: Single parent families are not given enough support or income to gain qualifications for highly paid employment to surpport their children and make a better and secure future for them selves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintenance grants replaced with Maintenon loans 
Denied housing benefit if return to full time higher education 
Lack of support for child care

attributes.action: Give agency staff permanent contracts by law after 6 months with same company
attributes.background: Agency workers are used by companies as a disposable resource. Yes not all staff want to stay with the same company, but the majority do. All agency workers want is a permanent contract, fair working wage, and conditions after 6 months working for a company that clearly needs them. No exceptions!
attributes.additional_details:
I currently work for a company through an agency in the North East UK.
I have been told on numerous occasions, that
"the company" has stated that NO ONE will be given permanent contracts for my job description, only certain departments offer contracts and that is EXTREMELY rare. 
Many of the staff on my department have worked with this company for over 2 years and are STILL being told by bosses things like "if you don't come in this Saturday (voluntary overtime) we'll just replace you"

attributes.action: Amend handgun commandments that illegalize pistol firearms.
attributes.background: I want licensed gun owners to able own pistols as I find it strange how the government allows for the use of shotguns and hunting rifles, however, neglects the use of a smaller, less powerful, and  considerably cheaper firearm to purchase in comparison to a shotgun that can be very expensive

attributes.action: Classify the laser pointer as an 'offensive weapon'
attributes.background: Following laser attacks on hundreds of civil aircraft, including Virgin Atlantic flight VS025 which was forced to return to Heathrow Airport, we call upon the government to classify the laser pointer as an offensive weapon. The mis-use of these devices put hundreds of lives at risk on a daily basis.

attributes.action: Make video recording of hearings in Courts and Employment Tribunals mandatory.
attributes.background: At present, litigants-in-person and certain groups receive hostile and unfair treatment in Courts and Tribunals. Employment tribunals do not record proceedings. Voice recordings in Courts are edited before being released. The system makes perjury possible and perversity in decisions unchallengeable.

attributes.action: Invest in a single nuclear deterrent with USA, France & Europe and stop Trident
attributes.background: A nuclear deterrent is an insurance policy or safety net you hope will never be used. The world just needs one safety net. We should join the Americans, French and Europeans and invest in a common nuclear deterrent for the democratic world saving billions and not build our own exclusive safety net.
attributes.additional_details:
This arises from an idea in the book Diagonal Lengths: Rethinking our world, (page 121) of a common body taking on the role to defend against Nuclear aggression, thereby saving individual countries from each having to invest in and develop their own nuclear deterrents.

With Trident due to cost £30 Bn, why don't we invest £10Bn into a common shared project with the US, France and rest of Europe to build a single nuclear deterrent and use the £20 Bn we save on other uses -NHS, Education, Research

attributes.action: Make our Road Tax and Fuel Tax get spent on the roads and not other things!
attributes.background:
Our roads are getting much worse and action needs to be taken. They are becoming dangerous and causing damage to our vehicles.
We pay tax on our fuel and we pay road tax which should be used to replace and repair the roads but isn't all spent on the roads which is appalling. 
LETS TAKE ACTION NOW

attributes.action: Conduct a national referendum to solve London’s airport capacity stalemate
attributes.background:
This petition suggests a nationwide referendum with the following options: 
No new Runways
New Runway at LHR
New Runway at Gatwick
New Runways at both Gatwick and Heathrow.
London airport capacity has been a recurrent and politically sensitive issue.
attributes.additional_details: This has resulted in a perpetuating pattern of indecision and enquiries. Air travel is recognised as being a driver of jobs and economic growth. The 2008 Greater Manchester Transport referendums should be used as a referendum template. The result of this democratic process should lead to a swift policy announcement, using public opinion to influence this decision as a way of decreasing the political bias that has historically surrounded the issue.

attributes.action: To allow the wife of veteran of ex-soldier Andrew McLaughlin, to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Andrew McLaughlin has an American wife and a 2-year old daughter and they have been denied entry into the UK because of the Government's strict laws on the rights of non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details: Andrew is a former soldier with the Grenadier Guards who served in Afghanistan from March to September 2012. He is from Warwickshire and is a lifelong Aston Villa fan. He married his American wife Wanda in December 2011 and they have a 2-year old daughter who have been refused entry to the UK because of his low income.

attributes.action: Don't Trigger Article 50 until at least after next US President takes office
attributes.background:
In deciding when UK should trigger Article 50, UK citizens demand that Government wait until next President of America has been elected & takes office. Triggering Article 50 should not be before 21 January 2017 
Future US Presidency could become protectionist. Benefits of Brexit could be tenuous
attributes.additional_details:
UK citizens are being told that exiting EU offers opportunity for UK to benefit from trade with other countries outside the EU.
However those in favour of Brexit fail to identify very real prospect that American could become very protectionist.
In assessing benefits of Brexit against real negatives of Brexit, UK government can only but proceed with extreme caution & wait until the election of next President of America & takes office to know for certain future benefits of Brexit.

attributes.action: Debit card charges to be set at a fair level and charges itemised on  reciept .
attributes.background:
Shop can currently charge what ever they like if a card is used .
goverment should set a max fee and ensure the fee charged is itemised on reciept

attributes.action: Hygiene Facilities in Educational Institutes for our Children
attributes.background: As a grandmother, I struggle at times as my grandchild comes home with her underwear unclean and parents and carers like me would like our children coming home clean and it would be easier for measures to put in place for hygiene purposes.

attributes.action: Redistribute 8 Billion saving from EU to areas with the highest unemployment.
attributes.background: If, we are to leave the EU, and the amount saved is 8 billion pounds. This money should not be swallowed up by tax cuts. It should go to alleviating poverty, in the areas that need it most.

attributes.action: Change UK Prostitution Laws to be in line with Norway, Sweden, Ireland, France.
attributes.background: The laws around prostitution in the UK are inefficient. Decriminalisation zones are proven to be ineffective, as demonstrated by the murder of Daria Pionko that took place in Leeds, December 2015. Laws around prostitution are in urgent need of reform to ensure this industry doesn't continue to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Signatories recommend:
- The prostituted be absolved of all criminality
- Investment is made in supporting prostituted persons to exit the sex trade via specialised training, support & health services
- Those at risk of entering prostitution are identified & supported to ensure they have viable career & education options
- The purchase of sexual access to human bodies is criminalised & subject to custodial penalty
- Consultation with Survivor Organisations is undertaken to inform legislation

attributes.action: Make accusing someone of been a racist without hard evidence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: In light of the recent EU referendum decision and increase in reports of hate crimes, a lot of innocent, decent and hardworking people like myself have been victims of accusations suggesting (with no proof or evidence to support their claims) that people who voted to leave the EU are somehow racist.
attributes.additional_details:
Branding someone as racist without any categorical evidence what so ever also seems to be a tactic that is becoming more of a problem in political and also everyday situations. 

Certain demographics of people are using this tactic to persecute other demographics of people in order to silence their personal views or beliefs to further their own personal or political agendas.

Been racist is a disgusting crime and been wrongly accused with no evidence can be permanently damaging to peoples lives.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over £80 million pounds – an average cost of £3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Ban Wearing Burka's While Driving
attributes.background: I and many others will agree that woman wearing a burka should not be allowed to drive a vehicle this is highly dangerous as you do not have full vision of the road and things surrounding you.
attributes.additional_details: I understand this item of clothing worn is a sign of religion. This does not take away the fact of how dangerous wearing this is whilst driving. This has been recently banned in France and I think the UK should take action against this to prevent very serious accidents or even death happening.

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: Make rail companies social enterprises instead of profit-making parasites
attributes.background: The shambolic performance of Southern rail shows that the system is broken. People are in fear of losing their jobs because they cannot reliably get a train to work. Parents spend little time with their children because of delayed journeys home. Who and what are the rail companies for?

attributes.action: STOP the closure of another A&E department in the North East...
attributes.background: Proposals would see A&E departments across Teesside, Durham and Darlington reduced from four to three; putting additional pressure on existing services.  Contradicting the Government’s pledge to ‘improve the health of the country’ and 'making services easier for patients to access'.
attributes.additional_details: The loss of local A&E Services in Hartlepool in 2011, has already caused unnecessary hardship and inconvenience for patients who now travel to Stockton to access A&E.  The road infrastructure (A19 / A66) is inadequate; causing delays for ambulances and patients, potentially causing unnecessary deaths.  The remaining four A&E Departments serve Hartlepool, Stockton, Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland and Darlington, with a total population of 662,800 (2011 Census).

attributes.action: DfE to deliver assessment frameworks for 2016-17 as they were promised by now.
attributes.background: The interim frameworks "support teachers in making robust and accurate judgements for pupils at the end of key stage 2 in 2016" were delivered late to teachers. Plus, they're only for a year. The DfE have been "evaluating options for future years" for over a year and still nothing for 2016-2017.

attributes.action: Rejecting Brexit - find a better alternative to leaving the EU.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to refrain from invoking Article 50. Instead we call upon you to work with the other 27 EU members to find a solution to the issues associated with the free movement of people throughout the EU and, if necessary, to subsequently hold a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A key issue for many who voted to leave the EU is unlimited migration of EU citizens into the UK. The issue of migration within the EU impacts countries beyond the UK and must be addressed by the EU as a whole to prevent further countries voting to leave.

If the UK were to leave the EU around half the UK population would still be left dissatisfied. By contrast, we believe that the UK remaining in a reformed EU could satisfy a significantly larger majority of the UK population.

attributes.action: Home Office should issue temporary travel document to travel from and to UK
attributes.background: Home office take too long to take a decision on naturalisation decision. While it is understandable the time to take the decision, they should be able to issue travel documents so that applicants can travel to their original country in case of an emergency
attributes.additional_details: Applied for my 3 year old son's naturalisation application 3 months back. It is still pending. There is a requirement for him to travel to India but cannot do it as he is still waiting for a decision. I'm requesting Home Office to be able to issue temporary visa do that applicants can travel in case of any emergency out of UK and be able to come back to UK

attributes.action: For the UK Government to follow the policy of free trade globally
attributes.background: In this new age the UK needs to apply policies that reflect and encourage commerce throughout all nations and islands of the United Kingdom and to encourage this with all nations we trade with. This will show a willingness for free market economics to promote prosperity globally not just the UK.

attributes.action: Review how MPs are elected, can exercise power & standards they must adhere to.
attributes.background:
We seek government through consensus, with resources used to achieve our priorities: 
Access to healthcare & education based on need, not ability to pay.
Mental and physical health have equal status
Economic profitability is only a tool to facilitate the achievement of these priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs shall: 
-live and work in the constituency they represent
-use publicly available local education and health services.
-not receive any direct or indirect financial benefit other than their salary as an MP.
-not hold any office in any organisation during their tenure as MP, whether voluntary or paid.
-MPs income from investments, business or other interests shall be accumulated in a zero interest account. 
-not exercise any voting rights or other powers they may have over such funds.

attributes.action: Conscientious objection to military taxation
attributes.background: I no longer want to pay the percentage of taxes that are used to fund military budget. I feel that I am indirectly funding the killing of others. I am morally against this and no longer want to contribute to it through conscientious objection to military taxation.
attributes.additional_details: Conscientious objection to military tax is thought to be an extension to objection to military service. A person with a religious or ethical scruple against taking part in killing people during war is likely to feel no less scruple about paying somebody else to do the killing or about purchasing the mechanism of killing. If a government can respect the right of a person not to participate directly in making war, can it also respect the right of the person to avoid this indirect participation.

attributes.action: Fly British flags in major cities
attributes.background:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example
attributes.additional_details:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example

attributes.action: A tenant should not be evicted, after expiry of the tenancy without any reason.
attributes.background: A tenant usually sign tenancy agreement for 12 months, but after the expiry of the tenancy agreement, landlord issues him 2 month's Section 21 Notice and evict him by county court order. This destroys the family life of the tenant. He needs to struggle again to establish a normal family life.

attributes.action: If the UK is forced to leave the EU, the government should apply to rejoin it.
attributes.background:
On 23rd June the EU referendum returned a small majority in favour of the UK leaving the EU. As of yet it is still unclear whether or not Article 50 will be invoked and we actually have to leave.

Should the UK be forced to leave the EU then the government should begin proceedings to rejoin it.

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for neighbours to record you & your property with CCTV!
attributes.background:
Currently, there are no laws governing the use of domestic CCTV  which impacts the neighbouring resident's privacy. Neighbours are able to record you, your family & your property. LEGALLY

Your privacy can be taken away from you & placed in the hands of your neighbours! PROTECT YOUR PRIVACY!
attributes.additional_details:
My neighbour has recently installed CCTV which captures the whole of my garden. He now has 24/7 access to my whole garden and is able to sit and watch us from his smart phone whenever he wishes! 

We have asked him to move the cameras as we have children and would prefer that they are not recorded! He has refused and there is nothing we can about it but to create this petition in hopes that you will sign to help bring back our privacy. 

We need to protect ourselves and our families! PLEASE SIGN

attributes.action: Ban tenant renewal fees
attributes.background: Why should we, the tenants, or even the landlords, have to pay out an extreme amount of money just for estate agents to print out the exact same paper as they did before, with just a couple of numbers changed? I SAY NO!
attributes.additional_details:
This world is hard enough you love in with all the prices on rent, bill, shopping etc, increasing all the time.
Estate agents make enough money from us.
It's extortionate for them to request more money for then to do absolutely nothing other than print out a bit of paper.
Anyone can do this.

That money being requested could go towards a lot of things you need.
DON'T let them keep doing this to you.
DON'T let them rip you off!!
Sign now, and let's fight back to take what is OURS!!

attributes.action: We will not tolerate public acts of discrimination
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Govt. to increase punitive measures in response to public acts of aggressive, racial and xenophobic discrimination by 50% for a period of 1 year following the EU Referendum. We believe this will send the clear message that the People of Britain do not tolerate racism.
attributes.additional_details: In the wake of the EU referendum, the risk that racism and bigotry will show itself as an accepted part of our society is higher than ever. By signing this petition, you are calling on our Government to take official steps to show that we are not a racist, bigoted nation and will punish those who seek to do harm to another person because of their culture, religion, country of origin or ethnicity and those who seek to alienate  people along these lines during this political upheaval.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for every new housing development to include vital services
attributes.background: At the moment in the UK were are facing a crisis - Public services are under strain. School places are in short supply as are doctors and other vital infrastructure. This IS NOT down to immigrants but the failure of councils and central government to ensure developers build these vital services.
attributes.additional_details: Developers need to take responsibility and build essential services into their sprawling developments to aide the struggling public services instead of grabbing as much profit as possible and ignoring the effect their builds are having on local services.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Dangerous Dogs Act 1991'
attributes.background: Everyday innocent dogs around the UK are dragged from their homes, stuffed into kennel's with other petrified dogs away form their owners and are 'destroyed'. A large number of these dogs are just puppies and have never shown any signs of aggression. They are dying due to breed discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Its about time we started to realise that no dogs are dangerous, only owners. We have known this for centuries yet we still allow criminals to breed these types of animals excluded within the Dangerous Dogs Act and we have almost zero accountability over our pet owners within the United Kingdom. 

We must propose a new system in which owners/breeders are held accountable for their animal no matter what breed and encourage education rather than destruction with this issue.

attributes.action: Discuss a National Coalition government after the EU referendum result
attributes.background: Britain exiting the EU is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. Unity is required and there are concerns of a rise in too far to the right politics.
attributes.additional_details: Exiting Europe is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. A rise in racism and contempt has been reported by immigrants and by people of a minority ethnicity and I feel the British people need reassurances that the goverment won't be led too far right. A Tory lead coalition government with Labour and SNP should be discussed. I feel the coalition will offer stability and offer the best negotiations for the British people when exiting the EU.

attributes.action: Free statin and other long term and lifelong medication
attributes.background: Not all long term medication is free of prescription charges.
attributes.additional_details:
Unless you are receiving benefit, statins and many other long term drugs are subject to a £8.40 charge; per medication. There are many people that are employed but struggle to afford this. These prescription charges represent nothing more than an unfair, stealth tax. 
If the general population were forced to pay an additional £8.40 in tax, every month for life, there would be public uproar! 
This is immoral, fundamentally wrong and needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Second EU referendum if the UK fall into a recession.
attributes.background: Due to the dramatic drop in the value of GBP following the 'leave' party winning the 'Brexit' vote, It is highly likely that the UK will fall into a recession and face brutal austerity. Sign this petition to trigger a second vote to alleviate it's affect on our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The current Chancellor of the Exchequer has predicted this recession will leave households £4,300 worse of on average.

attributes.action: Before triggering Article 50 an initial UK-EU deal must be handled by Vote Leave
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, activation of Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty should only take place once an initial agreement, outlining key areas of the future relationship, has been reached between the UK and EU. The negotiation should be led by prominent members of the Vote Leave campaign.

attributes.action: A second referendum if UK job losses exceed 12,000 after initiating Article 50.
attributes.background: The referendum campaigns were based on projections that were largely distrusted. A "pain threshold" of 12,000 job losses would be the equivalent of three "Port Talbot Steelworks", the latter creating considerable public out-cry when the potential 4000 job losses were announced in March 2016.
attributes.additional_details: If corporations announce expected job cuts that they will implement if the Article 50 process is initiated, then there will be some threshold over which the electorate and politicians on either side of the debate should be allowed to reconsider their referendum position. Announcements of UK job losses on Friday 24th June already include JP Morgan (4,000), HSBC and Morgan Stanley with the first already matching Port Talbot. A second referendum can help the United Kingdom avoid such job losses.

attributes.action: Make hate crime an urgent national priority in the wake of the EU referendum.
attributes.background: There is mounting evidence that hate crimes are occurring as a direct result of the EU referendum. This must be dealt with firmly and swiftly by ensuring that every police force is ready and able to address this situation. It is spiralling out of control and many people are fearful.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.standard.co.uk/news/crime/police-probe-racist-signs-distributed-after-brexit-vote-in-eu-referendum-a3281021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/brexit-eu-referendum-racial-racism-abuse-hate-crime-reported-latest-leave-immigration-a7104191.html

attributes.action: Introduce pre-referendum as an entry requirement before future major referendums
attributes.background: Before important future referendum i.e. like should UK be in the EU or not? A pre-referendum is issued first  to ensure that eligible voters understand what they are voting for. The results of pre-referendum should be used as weighting to set the criteria that main referendum is considered passed.
attributes.additional_details: It is obvious from personal stories from friends and families and other stories trending on the internet that a significant number of people voted when they did not know what they were really voting for and also were using as a protest rather than considering and forming balanced opinion based on informed arguments for yes or no.

attributes.action: Parliamentary inquiry into deceitful claims to sway an election or referendum
attributes.background: The Brexit campaign dishonestly pledged £350 million per week for the NHS in full knowledge that this was was an impossibility.  This is just one example of a growing trend in British politics.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a growing tendency for candidates to field statements that they know to be wrong merely to gain a vote for their party or themselves.  Integrity is being eroded together with the high standards that once reflected British politics and decisions.  Can a successful vote won on the basis of deceit be democratically or morally valid?
I believe that it is time to openly discuss this problem through the proper vehicle of a parliamentary enquiry into such practices.

attributes.action: Electoral vote of acceptance of any Prime minister not Elected
attributes.background: A lot of people vote for the public face of a political party are electing a Prime minister to lead the country, if a political party in Government has to choose a new leader whom will become Prime minister the electorate should have the right approve or reject that person.

attributes.action: Disband the office of the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: Since 1651 we the subjects United Kingdom and the commonwealth have only had a hand full of successful Prime  Ministers, I believe that we should empower our Monarchy with the full powers invested in a head of state

attributes.action: Hold a second EU membership referendum within 18 months.
attributes.background:
(1) Young people could not vote.
(2) Voters based their decision to leave on incomplete information.
(3) Winning margin was too narrow. 

A referendum of this weight should allow 16 - 17 year old people to vote. 

The UK should only exit if leave vote wins by a substantial margin.
attributes.additional_details:
(1) http://goo.gl/krTYyR (Independent)

(2) http://goo.gl/wBfX74 (The Guardian) and https://goo.gl/1Jd1Mp (Washington Post)

(3) http://goo.gl/SXEWTS (Mirror)

To quote the UKIP leadership, the winning margin was too narrow and therefore this is unfinished business by a long way.

The very existence of the United Kingdom as we know it and of the European Union, built over 7 decades, hangs in the balance.

attributes.action: Hold a second Brexit referendum in 2 years so that more young voters have a say.
attributes.background: Article 50 means that we do not formally leave the EU for at least two years. During this time a large number of 16-17 year olds will become eligible to vote. The government will not lower the voting age, but we should allow eligible youngsters to decide either way on their future.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should also consider working with the youth parliament and implementing a way of allowing them to have a say on their future.

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.
